lineage.Process: FeatureClassToFeatureClass "USA Federal Lands" D:\DOE\Data\lower48.gdb federal_lands # "FEATURE1 "FEATURE1" true true false 50 Text 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,FEATURE1,0,50;NAME1 "NAME1" true true false 250 Text 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,NAME1,0,250;ADMIN1 "ADMIN1" true true false 10 Text 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,ADMIN1,0,10;FEATURE2 "FEATURE2" true true false 50 Text 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,FEATURE2,0,50;NAME2 "NAME2" true true false 250 Text 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,NAME2,0,250;ADMIN2 "ADMIN2" true true false 10 Text 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,ADMIN2,0,10;FEATURE3 "FEATURE3" true true false 50 Text 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,FEATURE3,0,50;NAME3 "NAME3" true true false 250 Text 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,NAME3,0,250;ADMIN3 "ADMIN3" true true false 10 Text 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,ADMIN3,0,10;STATE "STATE" true true false 10 Text 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,STATE,0,10;STATE_FIPS "STATE_FIPS" true true false 10 Text 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,STATE_FIPS,0,10;SQMI "SQMI" true true false 8 Double 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,SQMI,-1,-1;SHAPE_Length "Shape_Length" false true true 8 Double 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,SHAPE_Length,-1,-1;SHAPE_Area "Shape_Area" false true true 8 Double 0 0,First,#,USA Federal Lands,SHAPE_Area,-1,-1" #

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent the federally owned or administered lands of 320 acres or more (some smaller areas deemed to be important or significant are also included) within the United States.
enttyp.enttypds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The primary or only type of federal land. Where an area represents multiple federal land types, this field describes the smaller or 'contained' land.
attr.attrdefs: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: Land designated for use by the U.S. Air Force National Guard.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: Land designated for use by the U.S. Air Force.

edom.edomvd: Land designated for use by the U.S. Coast Guard.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A unit of the National Wildlife Refuge System which is subject to the National Wildlife Refuge Administration Act of 1966, but which is managed by State fish and wildlife agencies which have nearly full jurisdiction.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area of land reserved for a tribe or tribes under treaty or other agreement with the United States, executive order, or federal statute or administrative action as permanent tribal homelands, and where the federal government holds title to the land in trust on behalf of the tribe.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A water area owned or administered by BOR or TVA.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A land area owned or administered by BOR or TVA.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: Land designated for use by the U.S. Marine Corps.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: Metropolitan Washington Airports Authority - A National airport in the Washington, DC, metropolitan area.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: Land reserved for the protection and recognition of a historic battlefield.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A military cemetery containing the graves of U.S. Armed Forces veterans and personnel, their spouses and dependents. These cemeteries may also contain the graves of other people, such as national figures or Confederate soldiers. For those without a military connection, the Secretary of Veterans Affairs or the Secretary of Defense determines eligibility for burial in a national cemetery.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: Land designated by Congress to conserve, protect, and enhance public land areas for the benefit and enjoyment of present and future generations.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area designated for the conservation, restoration, enhancement, and management of the Nation's fishery resources and aquatic ecosystems.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area established for the protection of forest resources.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area designated by Presidential Proclamation or by Congress for the protection of wildlife.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area designated by the Secretary of Agriculture and permanently held by the Department of Agriculture under Title III of the Bankhead-Jones Farm Tenant Act.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A national park of historic significance.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A NPS unit which provides for preservation of historical cultural development and natural landscapes, through a partnership of Federal, State, and local agencies.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area designated as being of national historic significance due to a single feature.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A federally funded research and development center.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A designated area along the Great Lakes shoreline, established to preserve and protect recreational coastline.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area of land commemorating an historic individual or event.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A national park established for the protection and recognition of a military site or action.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area administered for the protection of historic landmarks, historic and prehistoric structures, or other objects of historic or scientific interest.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area that contains the best remaining example of a specific biological and (or) geological feature.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A tract of land, having a wide variety of attributes, protected and preserved for the use and enjoyment of the public.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A roadway and the connected land or cultural sites paralleling the roadway, intended for scenic motoring along a protected corridor.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A tract of land set aside for the preservation of scenic or wildlife areas.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area centered on a large reservoir, emphasizing water-based recreation, or centered near a major population center to preserve historic resources and other natural areas that provide outdoor recreation.

edom.edomvd: An area set aside as a wildlife reserve.

edom.edomvd: A designated area along the Atlantic, Pacific, or Gulf coast, established to preserve and protect recreational coastline.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: An area of essentially undisturbed, roadless, public lands of 5000 acres or more, that retains a primeval character, without permanent improvements and that generally appears to have been affected primarily by the forces of nature.

edom.edomvd: A tract of land or water protected for the preservation of wildlife.

edom.edomvd: Land designated for use by the U.S. Navy.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A Federal facility that is not otherwise classified. Includes experimental ranges, federal office complexes, etc.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A tract of public land owned by the U.S. Government and administered by the Bureau of Land Management, but not designated for a specific use.

edom.edomvd: A tract of land or water set aside to protect natural ecosystems or natural features, to allow for scientific study, education, and maintenance of biological diversity.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A federally owned or managed site established for the testing of nuclear devices.
edom.edomvds: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

edom.edomvd: A wetland or grassland critical to waterfowl and other wildlife, managed as part of the National Wildlife Refuges Program.

edom.edomvd: A wild, scenic, and (or) recreational river, protected to preserve the river in its free-flowing condition.

edom.edomvd: An area established to conserve and enhance wildlife and wildlife habitat, and to provide public recreation opportunities.

rpCntInfo.cntInstr:
In the United States, contact the Esri Sales staff at 800-447-9778 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/offices.

distorOrdPrc.ordInstr: Data and Maps is available only as part of Esri® software.

distorFormat.formatInfo: To use this data requires software that supports FGDB files.

idCitation.resTitle: U.S. National Atlas Federal Land Areas

citRespParty.rpOrgName: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey

dataIdInfo.idAbs: U.S. National Atlas Federal Land Areas represents the federally owned or administered land areas (for example, National Wildlife Refuges, National Monuments, and National Conservation Areas) of the United States. For the most part, only areas of 320 acres or more are included; some smaller areas deemed to be important or significant are also included. There may be private inholdings within the boundaries of Federal lands as well.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: U.S. National Atlas Federal Land Areas provides the federally owned or administered land areas for geographic display and analysis at regional and national levels.

rpCntInfo.cntInstr:
In the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, you may contact Esri Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; or visit http://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/offices. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

LegConsts.othConsts:
The data are provided by multiple, third party data vendors under license to Esri for inclusion on Data and Maps for ArcGIS® for use with Esri® software. Each data vendor has its own data licensing policies and may grant varying redistribution rights to end users. Please consult the redistribution rights below for this data set provided on Data and Maps. As used herein, “Geodata” shall mean any digital data set consisting of geographic data coordinates and associated attributes.
The redistribution rights for this data set: Public domain data from U.S. government is freely redistributable with proper metadata and source attribution.
The terms and conditions below apply to all the data sets provided on Data and Maps.
Proprietary Rights and Copyright: Licensee acknowledges that the Data and Related Materials contain proprietary and confidential property of Esri and its licensor(s). The Data and Related Materials are owned by Esri and its licensor(s) and are protected by United States copyright laws and applicable international copyright treaties and/or conventions.
Limited Warranty and Disclaimer: Esri warrants that the media upon which the Data and Related Materials are provided will be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal use and service for a period of ninety (90) days from the date of receipt.
THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS ARE EXCLUDED FROM THE LIMITED WARRANTY, AND THE LICENSEE EXPRESSLY ACKNOWLEDGES THAT THE DATA CONTAINS SOME NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS. ESRI DOES NOT WARRANT THAT THE DATA WILL MEET LICENSEE'S NEEDS OR EXPECTATIONS; THAT THE USE OF THE DATA WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED; OR THAT ALL NONCONFORMITIES, DEFECTS, OR ERRORS CAN OR WILL BE CORRECTED. ESRI IS NOT INVITING RELIANCE ON THIS DATA, AND THE LICENSEE SHOULD ALWAYS VERIFY ACTUAL DATA.
EXCEPT FOR THE LIMITED WARRANTY SET FORTH ABOVE, THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS CONTAINED THEREIN ARE PROVIDED "AS-IS," WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY AND FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
HIGH RISK ACTIVITIES: (A) THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS ARE NOT FAULT-TOLERANT AND ARE NOT DESIGNED, MANUFACTURED, OR INTENDED FOR USE OR RESALE FOR INSURANCE UNDERWRITING OR WITH CRITICAL HEALTH AND SAFETY OR ONLINE CONTROL EQUIPMENT IN HAZARDOUS ENVIRONMENTS THAT REQUIRE FAIL-SAFE PERFORMANCE, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE OPERATION OF NUCLEAR FACILITIES, NAVIGATION OR GUIDANCE (I.E., AIRCRAFT, NAUTICAL VEHICLE, ETC.), OR COMMUNICATION SYSTEMS, AIR TRAFFIC CONTROL, EMERGENCY RESPONSE, TERRORISM PREVENTION OR RESPONSE, LIFE SUPPORT, OR WEAPONS SYSTEMS ("HIGH RISK ACTIVITIES"). ESRI SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS ANY EXPRESS OR IMPLIED WARRANTY OF FITNESS FOR HIGH RISK ACTIVITIES.
(B) TO THE EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, LICENSEE AGREES TO INDEMNIFY, DEFEND, AND HOLD ESRI, ITS OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES, AGENTS, SUBCONTRACTORS, LICENSORS, SUCCESSORS, AND ASSIGNS HARMLESS FROM AND AGAINST ANY AND ALL LIABILITY, LOSSES, CLAIMS, EXPENSES (INCLUDING ATTORNEYS' FEES), DEMANDS, OR DAMAGES OF ANY KIND, INCLUDING DIRECT, INDIRECT, SPECIAL, PUNITIVE, INCIDENTAL, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, ARISING OUT OF OR IN ANY WAY CONNECTED WITH LICENSEE'S USE OR PERMITTING THE USE BY OTHERS OF THE DATA, AND VENDOR'S HARDWARE OR SOFTWARE FOR HIGH RISK ACTIVITIES. DELIVERY OF THE DATA, AND VENDOR'S HARDWARE OR SOFTWARE DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A WAIVER OF THE RIGHTS AND OBLIGATIONS SET FORTH IN THIS ARTICLE.
Exclusive Remedy and Limitation of Liability: The entire liability of Esri or its licensor(s) and Licensee's exclusive remedy shall be to terminate the Agreement upon Licensee returning the Data and Related Materials to Esri with a copy of Licensee's invoice/receipt and Esri returning the license fees paid to Licensee.
IN NO EVENT SHALL ESRI AND/OR ITS LICENSOR(S) BE LIABLE FOR COSTS OF PROCUREMENT OF SUBSTITUTE GOODS OR SERVICES; LOST PROFITS, LOST SALES, OR BUSINESS EXPENDITURES, INVESTMENTS, OR COMMITMENTS IN CONNECTION WITH ANY BUSINESS; LOSS OF ANY GOODWILL; OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, EXEMPLARY, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF THIS AGREEMENT OR USE OF THE DATA AND RELATED MATERIALS, HOWEVER CAUSED, ON ANY THEORY OF LIABILITY, AND WHETHER OR NOT ESRI OR ITS LICENSOR(S) HAVE BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGE. THESE LIMITATIONS SHALL APPLY NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF ANY EXCLUSIVE REMEDY.
Third Party Beneficiary: Esri's licensor(s) has (have) authorized Esri to (sub)distribute and (sub)license its (their) data as incorporated into the Data and Related Materials. As an intended third party beneficiary to this Agreement, the Esri licensor(s) is (are) entitled to directly enforce, in its own name, the rights and obligations undertaken by the Licensee and to seek all legal and equitable remedies as are afforded to Esri.
In the event that the data vendor(s) has (have) granted the end user permission to redistribute the Geodata, please use proper proprietary or copyright attribution for the various data vendor(s), and provide the associated metadata file(s) with the Geodata. In compliance with FGDC metadata standards, Esri has attempted to practice proper metadata methodologies by providing any data source information, descriptions, and file names to assist in this effort.

report.measDesc: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.

After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
This map layer includes Federal land features for all fifty United States, the District of Columbia, Puerto Rico, and the U.S. Virgin Islands. The minimum map resolution is 320 acres. Generally, features under this size are not shown. There may be private inholdings within the boundaries of Federal lands in this map layer. Some established Federal lands which are larger than the minimum map resolution are not included in this map layer because their boundaries were not available from the owning or administering agency.
The data should be displayed and analyzed at scales appropriate for 1:1,000,000-scale data. The horizontal positional accuracy is unknown.

srcCitatn.resTitle: 1:1,000,000-Scale Federal Lands of the United States
srcCitatn.resAltTitle: National Geospatial Program, The National Map Small Scale (formally National Atlas of the United States)

citRespParty.rpOrgName: National Geospatial Program, The National Map Small Scale (formally National Atlas of the United States)

prcStep.stepDesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Downloaded the compressed file from The National Map Small Scale website and extracted it. Removed one duplicate feature. Kept most source fields. Renamed source fields GNIS_Name1, GNIS_Name2, and GNIS_Name3 to NAME1, NAME2, and NAME3, respectively. Added field SQMI and calculated its values from source GIS_acres using an acres to square miles conversion. Projected the data to WGS 1984. Calculated all ‘N/A’ field values to blank.

srcCitatn.resAltTitle: National Geospatial Program, The National Map Small Scale (formally National Atlas of the United States)
